metadata.title: CVE-2019-9812 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Given a compromised sandboxed content process due to a separatevulnerability, it is possible to escape that sandbox by loadingaccounts.firefox.com in that process and forcing a log-in to a maliciousFirefox Sync account. Preference settings that disable the sandbox are thensynchronized to the local machine and the compromised browser would restartwithout the sandbox if a crash is triggered. This vulnerability affectsFirefox ESR < 60.9, Firefox ESR < 68.1, and Firefox < 69.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
firefox-geckodriver - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4').
